intro: Maytenus arbutifolia, commonly known as the Spanish bayonet, is a shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and distinctive, spiny stems. The leaves are typically elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a glossy appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers followed by bright red berries that attract birds. It is often found in coastal and dry forest habitats, showcasing its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
